Comments_List: I learned about defining sentences by their truth values, I learned about lambda saturation and abstraction, first order predicate logic, plenty of syntax and about tense.
Predicate logic, lambda calculus, critical thinking.
I think this course is a bit challenging for those who are not used to the type of notations and abstractions learned in class. It was a bit challenging for me.

The course was well organized. Prof Kotek was great at explaining/teaching the material. The course was challenging and made you think critically and outside the box. The courseload was very heavy and given that the content builds upon each other, it would be great to receive answersheets to problem sets.
Yes, I would. I think that, even if a student is not planning on becoming a semanticist, they would gain knowledge about the field and that this would help them understand language in a new way.
Definitely. This is a challenging and demanding course, but the course forces you to think critically by using the tools we were taught in class and apply them to novel problems.
